Package io.github.ai4ci.functions

Interface Coordinates

@Immutable public interface Coordinates
A compact representation of paired coordinates with optional link transformations for each axis and duplicate handling.

Main purpose: provide a small value type that accepts raw x/y arrays, applies domain and range link functions, filters points to a bounded support and produces cleaned coordinate arrays suitable for monotone spline fitting.

Key features:

  • Apply independent LinkFunction transforms to x and y data
  • Filter points to a configurable support window
  • Resolve duplicate transformed x-values by mean, max or min
  • Produce derived arrays getHx() and getHy() used by spline builders and interpolators

Downstream uses: consumed by EmpiricalDistribution when preparing data for spline fitting, and by SplineInterpolator for constructing monotone cubic splines.

Author:
Rob Challen

    Coordinates.DuplicateResolution
    Resolution strategies for duplicate transformed x keys.

    default double[]
    getHx()
    Returns the transformed x-coordinates after applying the x link and aggregating duplicates according to resolveDuplicates().

    resolveDuplicates()
    Strategy used when multiple transformed x values collide after applying getXLink() (duplicate transformed keys).

  • Method Details

    • getHx

      @Derived default double[] getHx()
      Returns the transformed x-coordinates after applying the x link and aggregating duplicates according to resolveDuplicates().
      Returns:
      an array of transformed x values suitable for spline fitting

    • getHy

      @Derived default double[] getHy()
      Returns the transformed y values corresponding to getHx(). If multiple original points map to the same transformed x the values are combined according to resolveDuplicates().
      Returns:
      an array of transformed y values aligned with getHx()

    • getX

      double[] getX()
      The raw x coordinate array.
      Returns:
      an array of x values in the original domain order

    • getXLink

      LinkFunction getXLink()
      The link function applied to x coordinates prior to processing.
      Returns:
      the LinkFunction for the x axis

    • getXMax

      @Default default double getXMax()
      Upper bound of the x support used when mapping points. Defaults to the maximum support of the x link function.
      Returns:
      the maximum x value considered for mapping

    • getXMin

      @Default default double getXMin()
      Lower bound of the x support used when mapping points. Defaults to the minimum support of the x link function.
      Returns:
      the minimum x value considered for mapping

    • getY

      double[] getY()
      The raw y coordinate array corresponding to getX().
      Returns:
      an array of y values where getY()[i] pairs with getX()[i]

    • getYLink

      LinkFunction getYLink()
      The link function applied to y coordinates prior to processing.
      Returns:
      the LinkFunction for the y axis

    • getYMax

      @Default default double getYMax()
      Upper bound of the y support used when mapping points. Defaults to the maximum support of the y link function.
      Returns:
      the maximum y value considered for mapping

    • getYMin

      @Default default double getYMin()
      Lower bound of the y support used when mapping points. Defaults to the minimum support of the y link function.
      Returns:
      the minimum y value considered for mapping

    • isIncreasing

      boolean isIncreasing()
      Whether the x values are strictly increasing. If true additional boundary points based on getXMin()/getXMax() and getYMin()/getYMax() are inserted to guarantee full domain coverage for monotone interpolators.
      Returns:
      true if x is increasing, false otherwise

    • resolveDuplicates

      @Default default Coordinates.DuplicateResolution resolveDuplicates()
      Strategy used when multiple transformed x values collide after applying getXLink() (duplicate transformed keys).
      Returns:
      the duplicate resolution policy
